Intro: Eugene’s Room_Allocator¶

Room_Allocator is a python program that is designed to randomise living space and office allocation for fellows and staff at Andela.

Contents:

  • Installation and Getting Started
  • Features and Commands
    • Creating Rooms
    • Adding Persons
    • Printing Room Occupants
    • Printing Room Allocations
    • Printing UnAllocated
    • Reallocating Person
    • Loading People
    • Saving an Interactive Session
    • Loading an Interactive Session

Problem Spec

When a new Fellow joins Andela they are assigned an office space and an optional living space if they choose to opt in. When a new Staff joins they are assigned an office space only. An office can accommodate a maximum of 6 people. A living space can accommodate a maximum of 4 people. The goal of the project is to digitize and randomize a room allocation system for one of Andela Kenya’s facilities called The Dojo.

It is implemented as a command line program which can be run in any terminal (UNIX or Windows) to add persons, create rooms plus a host of other functions.

Note

Done in fulfillment of the first checkpoint as a requirement in the Andela fellowship program..
